Package org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.opt

Class DelayedSimulation

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.opt.DelayedSimulation
public class DelayedSimulation
extends java.lang.Object
This class provides methods for the computation of delayed simulation relations for label-on-transition Büchi automata. The implementation follows [Kousha Etessami, Thomas Wilke, Rebecca A. Schuller: Fair Simulation Relations, Parity Games, and State Space Reduction for Büchi Automata. SIAM J. Comput. 34(5): 1159-1175 (2005)]. Instead of small progress measure applied in the papers, we use the user-default parity game solver to solve delayed simulation games.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  DelayedSimulation.LOSCompoundState
    This class provides the compound state (b, s1, s2) where s1 is a state from a label-on-state automaton A1 and s2 is a state from a label-on-state automaton A2.
    static class  DelayedSimulation.LOTCompoundState
    This class provides the compound state (s1, s2, a) or (s1, s2) where s1 is a state from a label-on-transition automaton A1, s2 is a state from a label-on-transition automaton A2, and a is a symbol in the alphabet.

  • Method Details

    • getDelayedSimulationGame

      public Game getDelayedSimulationGame​(FSA aut)
      Returns a parity game used to compute the delayed simulation relation of a Büchi automaton. All states of the returned game are DelayedSimulation.LOSCompoundState if the Büchi automaton has labels on states while the states are DelayedSimulation.LOTCompoundState if the Büchi automaton has labels on transitions. The returned game guarantees that a compound game state (s1, s2) owned by GamePlayer.P1 is in the winning region of GamePlayer.P0 if and only if s1 is delayed simulated by s2.
      Parameters:
      aut - a Büchi automaton
      Returns:
      a parity game used to compute the delayed simulation relation of the Büchi automaton
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if aut is not a Büchi automaton

    • getDelayedSimulationGame

      public Game getDelayedSimulationGame​(FSA aut1, FSA aut2)
      Returns a parity game used to compute the delayed simulation relation of two Büchi automata. All states of the returned game are DelayedSimulation.LOSCompoundState if the Büchi automata has labels on states while the states are DelayedSimulation.LOTCompoundState if the Büchi automata has labels on transitions. The returned game guarantees that a compound game state (s1, s2) owned by GamePlayer.P1 is in the winning region of GamePlayer.P0 if and only if s1 in the first automaton is delayed simulated by s2 in the second automaton.
      Parameters:
      aut1 - a Büchi automaton
      aut2 - a Büchi automaton
      Returns:
      a parity game used to compute the delayed simulation relation of the Büchi automata
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if aut1 or aut2 is not a Büchi automaton, the automata have different alphabet type, or the automata have different label position

    • getDelayedSimulationRelation

      public Relation<State> getDelayedSimulationRelation​(FSA aut)
      Returns the delayed simulation relation of a Büchi automaton. If (s1, s2) is in the returned relation, then s1 is delayed simulated by s2. Instead of the small progress measure solver used in the original papers, the default parity game solver will be used to solve the delayed simulation game.
      Parameters:
      aut - a Büchi automaton
      Returns:
      the delayed simulation relation of the Büchi automaton
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if aut is not a Büchi automaton

    • getDelayedSimulationRelation

      public Relation<State> getDelayedSimulationRelation​(FSA aut, GameSolver<MemorylessStrategy> solver) throws UnsupportedException
      Returns the delayed simulation relation of a Büchi automaton. If (s1, s2) is in the returned relation, then s1 is delayed simulated by s2.
      Parameters:
      aut - a Büchi automaton
      solver - a parity game solver used to solve the delayed simulation game
      Returns:
      the delayed simulation relation of the Büchi automaton
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if aut is not a Büchi automaton
      UnsupportedException - if the specified game solver does not support parity games

    • getDelayedSimulationRelation

      public Relation<State> getDelayedSimulationRelation​(FSA aut1, FSA aut2)
      Returns the delayed simulation relation of two Büchi automata. If (s1, s2) is in the returned relation, then s1 in the first automaton is delayed simulated by s2 in the second automaton. Instead of the small progress measure solver used in the original papers, the default parity game solver will be used to solve the delayed simulation game.
      Parameters:
      aut1 - a Büchi automaton
      aut2 - a Büchi automaton
      Returns:
      the delayed simulation relation of the Büchi automata
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if aut1 or aut2 is not a Büchi automaton, the automata have different alphabet type, or the automata have different label position

    • getDelayedSimulationRelation

      public Relation<State> getDelayedSimulationRelation​(FSA aut1, FSA aut2, GameSolver<MemorylessStrategy> solver) throws UnsupportedException
      Returns the delayed simulation relation of two Büchi automata. If (s1, s2) is in the returned relation, then s1 in the first automaton is delayed simulated by s2 in the second automaton.
      Parameters:
      aut1 - a Büchi automaton
      aut2 - a Büchi automaton
      solver - a parity game solver used to solve the delayed simulation game
      Returns:
      the delayed simulation relation of the Büchi automata
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if aut1 or aut2 is not a Büchi automaton, the automata have different alphabet type, or the automata have different label position
      UnsupportedException - if the specified game solver does not support parity games

    • isDelayedSimulated

      public boolean isDelayedSimulated​(FSA aut1, FSA aut2)
      Returns true if the first specified Büchi automaton is delayed simulated by the second specified Büchi automaton. Instead of the small progress measure solver used in the original papers, the default parity game solver will be used to solve the delayed simulation game.
      Parameters:
      aut1 - a Büchi automaton
      aut2 - a Büchi automaton
      Returns:
      true if aut1 is delayed simulated by aut2
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if aut1 or aut2 is not a Büchi automaton, the automata have different alphabet type, or the automata have different label position

    • isDelayedSimulated

      public boolean isDelayedSimulated​(FSA aut1, FSA aut2, GameSolver<MemorylessStrategy> solver) throws UnsupportedException
      Returns true if the first specified Büchi automaton is delayed simulated by the second specified Büchi automaton.
      Parameters:
      aut1 - a Büchi automaton
      aut2 - a Büchi automaton
      solver - a parity game solver used to solve the delayed simulation game
      Returns:
      true if aut1 is delayed simulated by aut2
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if aut1 or aut2 is not a Büchi automaton, the automata have different alphabet type, or the automata have different label position
      UnsupportedException - if the specified game solver does not support parity games
